org.jsfml.graphics

Interface RenderTarget

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RenderTexture, RenderWindow

    public interface RenderTarget
    Interface for render targets.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear(Color color)
      Clears the render target and fills it with a constant color.
      void draw(Drawable drawable)
      Draws a drawable object to the render target using the default render states.
      void draw(Drawable drawable, RenderStates renderStates)
      Draws a drawable object to the render target using the given render states.
      void draw(Vertex[] vertices, PrimitiveType type)
      Draws a primitive of the given type using the given vertices and the default render states.
      void draw(Vertex[] vertices, PrimitiveType type, RenderStates states)
      Draws a primitive of the given type using the given vertices and the given render states.
      ConstView getDefaultView()
      Gets the target's default view.
      Vector2i getSize()
      Gets the size of the render region.
      ConstView getView()
      Gets the target's current view.
      IntRect getViewport(ConstView view)
      Computes the viewport of the given view applied to this render target.
      Vector2i mapCoordsToPixel(Vector2f point)
      Converts a point from world coordinates to target coordinates using the target's current view.
      Vector2i mapCoordsToPixel(Vector2f point, ConstView view)
      Converts a point from world coordinates to target coordinates for a certain view.
      Vector2f mapPixelToCoords(Vector2i point)
      Converts a point from target coordinates to world coordinates using the target's current view.
      Vector2f mapPixelToCoords(Vector2i point, ConstView view)
      Converts a point from target coordinates to world coordinates for a certain view.
      void popGLStates()
      Pops the last OpenGL states and matrices from the top of the stack.
      void pushGLStates()
      Pushes the current OpenGL states and matrices to the stack.
      void resetGLStates()
      Resets the internal OpenGL states so that the target is ready for drawing.
      void setView(ConstView view)
      Sets the target's view.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear(Color color)
        Clears the render target and fills it with a constant color.
        Parameters:
        color - the color to fill the target with.

      • setView

        void setView(ConstView view)
        Sets the target's view.
        Parameters:
        view - the target's new view.

      • getView

        ConstView getView()
        Gets the target's current view.
        Returns:
        the target's current view.

      • getDefaultView

        ConstView getDefaultView()
        Gets the target's default view.
        Returns:
        the target's default view.

      • getViewport

        IntRect getViewport(ConstView view)
        Computes the viewport of the given view applied to this render target.
        Parameters:
        view - the view.
        Returns:
        the viewport of the given view applied to this render target.

      • mapPixelToCoords

        Vector2f mapPixelToCoords(Vector2i point)
        Converts a point from target coordinates to world coordinates using the target's current view.
        Parameters:
        point - the point on the render target.
        Returns:
        the matching point in the world.

      • mapPixelToCoords

        Vector2f mapPixelToCoords(Vector2i point,
                        ConstView view)
        Converts a point from target coordinates to world coordinates for a certain view.
        Parameters:
        point - the point on the render target.
        view - the view to use for conversion.
        Returns:
        the matching point in the world.

      • mapCoordsToPixel

        Vector2i mapCoordsToPixel(Vector2f point)
        Converts a point from world coordinates to target coordinates using the target's current view.
        Parameters:
        point - the point in the world.
        Returns:
        the matching point on the render target.

      • mapCoordsToPixel

        Vector2i mapCoordsToPixel(Vector2f point,
                        ConstView view)
        Converts a point from world coordinates to target coordinates for a certain view.
        Parameters:
        point - the point in the world.
        view - the view to use for conversion.
        Returns:
        the matching point on the render target.

      • draw

        void draw(Drawable drawable)
        Draws a drawable object to the render target using the default render states.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the object to draw.

      • draw

        void draw(Drawable drawable,
        RenderStates renderStates)
        Draws a drawable object to the render target using the given render states.
        Parameters:
        drawable - the object to draw.
        renderStates - the render states to use for drawing.

      • draw

        void draw(Vertex[] vertices,
        PrimitiveType type)
        Draws a primitive of the given type using the given vertices and the default render states.
        Parameters:
        vertices - the vertices to draw.
        type - the type of OpenGL primitive to draw.

      • draw

        void draw(Vertex[] vertices,
        PrimitiveType type,
        RenderStates states)
        Draws a primitive of the given type using the given vertices and the given render states.
        Parameters:
        vertices - the vertices to draw.
        type - the type of OpenGL primitive to draw.
        states - the render states to use for drawing.

      • getSize

        Vector2i getSize()
        Gets the size of the render region.
        Returns:
        the size of the render region.

      • pushGLStates

        void pushGLStates()
        Pushes the current OpenGL states and matrices to the stack.

      • popGLStates

        void popGLStates()
        Pops the last OpenGL states and matrices from the top of the stack.

      • resetGLStates

        void resetGLStates()
        Resets the internal OpenGL states so that the target is ready for drawing.
